body.name: RØDE NT1 5th Generation Large-diaphragm Studio Condenser Microphone with XLR and USB Outputs, Shock Mount and Pop Filter for Music Production, Vocal Recording and Podcasting (Black)

features: Groundbreaking studio condenser microphone that fuses the classic sound signature of the iconic NT1 with patented next-generation technology

Connect to an audio interface or mixer via XLR, or plug directly into a computer via USB to record studio-grade sound in any setup – an all-in-one digital recording solution for the home or the studio

Offers the classic warm, silky character, extremely low self-noise and high SPL handling capability that the original is revered for, perfect for a huge range of applications, from voiceovers and guitars to drums and piano
Features RØDE’s ultra-low-noise, high-gain Revolution Preamp and high-resolution (up to 192kHz) analog-to-digital conversion for crystal-clear digital recordings
Body machined from high-grade aluminium with nickel plating and military-grade ceramic coating, ensuring its ready to take on the rigours of recording day in, day out
body.description: The latest evolution of RØDE’s iconic original studio microphone, the NT1 5th Generation preserves the legendary sound quality that made its predecessor the go-to studio microphone for countless creators while introducing cutting-edge, state-of-the-art technology. NT1 5th Generation is the world’s first studio microphone to offer both XLR and USB connectivity, featuring an on-board audio interface with studio-grade digital output, featuring a ultra-low-noise, high-gain Revolution Preamp™, high-resolution (192Khz) A/D conversion, advanced digital signal processing, and 32-bit float digital recording. The NT1 5th Generation is just at home plugged directly into a laptop as it is hooked up to a professional mixing console, and with a smooth frequency response, high SPL handling and the world’s lowest self-noise for a studio condenser microphone. It's ideal in a wide range of applications, from recording voiceovers or podcasts to capturing vocals, guitars, drums or piano – the ultimate studio microphone.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Our Iconic Original Studio Microphone, Reborn Introduced in 1991, the original NT1 revolutionised home recording. Now, the NT1 5th Generation takes the NT1’s core design and introduces patented, state-of-the-art features while preserving the legendary sound and build quality that made it the go-to studio mic for countless creators.

The World’s First Studio Mic with XLR and USB Connectivity The NT1 5th Generation features RØDE’s state-of-the-art Dual Connect output, which features both XLR and USB connectivity. This allows you to connect it to an audio interface or mixer just like a traditional studio microphone or plug it straight into your computer for plug-and-play recording.

Never Clip Your Audio The NT1 5th Generation is the world’s first microphone to feature a 32-bit float digital output. This allows you to record everything from a whisper to a scream without ever clipping your signal and without the need to worry about setting your levels before recording – an absolute game changer.

Classic Sound on the Cutting Edge The NT1 5th Generation offers the same classic warm, silky character that the original is known for, with a sparkling top end, detailed midrange and rich bass that makes every sound source shine – from vocals to guitars to drums. This classic sound signature can be further enhanced with the NT1 5th Generation’s powerful on-board digital signal processing for adding compression, high-pass filters, a noise gate, and the iconic APHEX Aural Exciter and Big Bottom for making any recording shine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sound quality is excellent
reviews.reviewText: This is a great product. Easy to set up and the sound quality is excellent. I am having some software issues, though. Only certain software can record 32-bit floating point audio. In Audacity, I am experiencing periods of a sudden drop in loudness of the recording, but only when doing long recordings (more than 10 minutes). The periods last for about 10 seconds and appear at random in the recordings. The recordings are unusable when this occurs. I am not moving on to Adobe Audition and will see what happens. I am presuming that this is a software issues and not a problem with the microphone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Microphone with Professional Sounde
reviews.reviewText: First off, this mic is super easy to use straight out of the box. I purchased an external interface (Scarlett Solo) just in case the built-in interface didn’t produce as good of a sound. Did comparison records and I could hear a slight difference between connecting directly via usb-c vs using the external interface. It was so close though that I didn’t know which was better, both had great clarity and sound quality. One friend thought the “without interface” sounded clearer and crisper, but two professionals whom I sent my clips to liked the “with interface” sound better and said it was a clearer RAW sound for me. Without the interface, it sounds slightly bass-y, like it's gone through a post-edit and been slightly Eq'd. I recorded in a walk-in closet using a reflector shield and the built in pop filter and you don't hear a “floor”. Suggestion... use the USB-C for when you travel (it'll do well in a pinch to just have the mic and laptop) and keep the interface set up in your home studio - love this versatility. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, there’s nowhere to plug in headphones if using the USB-C, so I do prefer using with the Scarlett interface. But I’m puzzled why this mic is $20 cheaper than the previous 4th generation that doesn’t have the built in interface option. Nevertheless, very happy with this mic and my new home studio set up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This mic is amazing. Sounds Great. Sounds Quality/Expensive but it's not. Very reasonably Priced and overall works Great for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rode 5th Gen mic
reviews.reviewText: I tested this mic out on the livestream. I was able to hear my natural voice crisp and clean, but bc the USB Type C is smaller than my SkyTech PC tower's regular USB ports and USB Port 3.0, I heard a little noise if I hear headphones for the audio or I didn't talk in certain parts of my vid, My speculation could be is bc I didn't have an audio box that can properly fit it into my PC's USB ports.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is supreme and doesn’t change usb vs xlr.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this mic!
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I started a You Tube channel, Mad Ferret Studios, over a year ago and wanted to upgrade our microphones. Originally, I went with 2 blue yeti x microphones but after days of fussing with the settings I wasn't able to get the sound that I wanted. I turned to this Rode microphone after reading and watching rave reviews for its ease of use and sound quality. I spent 5 minutes setting up both microphone and am extremely pleased with the sound quality. Don't buy blue yeti, spend the extra 100 and get this instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good for vocoders
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I can't sing, but I do love vocoders. One thing I've noticed about vocoders is that you really need to have a clean vocal recording to make the vocoder sound good. Since I'm not a singer, I didn't want to get a super expensive mic, so this mic turned out to be a good balance between price and qualityAnyway, here is a cover of Pony by Ginuwine using this mic

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tremendous upgrade for a vocalist
reviews.reviewText: After many reviews and research, I purchased this for my girlfriend, who's been a songwriter, singer for years. She mixes and engineers her music, and has always been cheap; never thought a mic upgrade would make such a difference in her singing. I surprised her with it last night, she plugged it into her audio interface and got to work. She was blown away of the clarity, especially at higher notes she would carry! If you are serious about your vocals, this microphone will impress!
The quality and price are very good. The reputation is just as it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Se convirtió en mi nuevo mejor amigo
reviews.reviewText: Me encanta cómo suena en mi voz y en guitarras acústicas, pienso que el micrófono me ama.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great mic - Came nicely boxed- I looked online as to how to set it up with my Mac book pro & it was really easy.Have done some vocal recording- lovely clean & warm sound. Can record other instruments in to it. Great sound. True reproduction. You can add plugins - affects after recording. Highly recommend 👍

reviews.reviewTitle: PARFAIT POUR UN HOMESTUDIO : Top Qualité !
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Je reviens vers mes premiers amours : J'avais l'ancienne génération était déjà au top mais la nouvelle est incroyable ! Lorsqu'on déballe on est fier d'avoir m'y ce prix. La qualité australien est fantastique, du micro en passant par le câble XLR (trop classe) en finissant par les attaches en scratch signé RODE. Le packaging annonce la couleur du design et de sa fiabilité. Après un test concluant, je le recommande pour toute personne qui a un home studio, il est juste parfait !

reviews.reviewTitle: You won’t find a better product in the price bracket
reviews.reviewText: There is no complaints about the product. Rode Nt 1 5gen is flawless. Only the seller sent me a already opened product. Please refer the photos. Other wise could have been a 5 star experience.
